history.content:
That is not too bad. If you need cs70 to declare then it might be kind of stressful, having to kind of focus on grades, but as long as you are on top of your homework and attend most of the lectures then it should be fine. 70 is definitely one of the most difficult undergraduate course in terms of material and the amount of time needed to complete the homework, and from what I heard 61c is a lot of material and requires a lot of work. However if these are the only two classes then I think it should be alright. 

Also I didn't realize if you were taking about 170 or 70 as your post mentions both. But 170 also is considered to be a heavy tech, and requires a lot of time. However some do consider it to be a bitter than the 70 workload. But in either case cs 70 and 61c or cs 170 and 61c should be manageable.

That is not too bad. If you need cs70 to declare then it might be kind of stressful, having to kind of focus on grades, but as long as you are on top of your homework and attend most of the lectures then it should be fine. 70 is definitely one of the most difficult undergraduate course in terms of material and the amount of time needed to complete the homework, and from what I heard 61c is a lot of material and requires a lot of work. However if these are the only two classes then I think it should be alright.

Hello.

I'm thinking about doing a reduced course workload while taking just CS61c and cs70 in the fall (no other classes). I heard that taking just these two classes together is harder than taking three technicals at the same time though. What do you think? W to hear other people's opinions.

Thx
history.subject: Taking only CS61c and CS170 in the fall (only these two classes)
